p: A particular type of acute heart failure involving non-ischemic myocardial stunning [ 189] has been called takotsubo cardiomyopathy [ 94], because left ventricular apical ballooning in this syndrome gives the radiographic appearance of a takotsubo, a type of Japanese pottery for catching octopuses. Takotsubo cardiomyopathy is especially common in post-menopausal women, for unknown reasons. Heart failure with apical akinesia can occur in disorders involving high circulating levels of catecholamines such as pheochromocytoma [ 62].
